page.title: 04Cockerham Church
page.content: Cockerham Church,dedicated to St. Michael, was in existence in 1153. Several churches have been built on the site, which stands isolated on high ground, surrounded by fields.The present Church dates from 1910.At the West end,attached to the Church,is the Tower dating from l589,which contains a peal of six bells. The Church consists of a central nave and two side aisles,with an entrance on the North side. There is very little stained glass,only the East window, depicting the four evangelists, and two memorial windows.The Churchyard surrounding the Church is used for the burial of parishioners.Cockerham was originally the mother Church to the neighbouring churches of Ellel & Shire shead.In 1974 the Parish of Cockerham was joined with Winmarleigh,sharing one Vicar,who resides in Cockerham.
